intro: Eriastrum pluriflorum subsp. sherman-hoytiae, commonly known as Sherman-Hoyt's eriastrum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has finely divided, grass-like leaves and is adapted to dry, rocky habitats. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants. Its botanical features make it well-suited for arid environments and it is often found in open, sunny areas.
